<citation>
However, it looks like you want to reuse set-up procedures between test
suites. If this is true, extract these methods into a third class
which you can use from your two test classes' setUp() methods.
</citation>
 
junit.extensions.TestSetup class (see javadoc in it)

-----Original Message-----
From: Malcolm Sparks [mailto:malcolm@...] 
Sent: Wednesday, October 22, 2003 12:23 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] How to extend our own testcase


Unless you specify a static suite() method, JUnit will search
your class and its superclasses for methods whose names begin with
'test'. You can't avoid this without adding your own suite() method
explicitly.

However, it looks like you want to reuse set-up procedures between test
suites. If this is true, extract these methods into a third class
which you can use from your two test classes' setUp() methods.

Malcolm

On Wed, 2003-10-22 at 14:59, Chirag Shashikant Doshi wrote:
> Hi all,
>  
> I have a Test Case class say BaseTest, There are some 10 odd tests in
> this class and a few setup methods. The test methods are bound to the
> setup methods ie. they expected the setup to have generated some
values
> which the test methods use for asserts. 
> Now I want to change one particular setup method to set up the values
> differently so that I can test a different functionality, here I am
> trying to check if a proper exception is raised. The approach I trie
was
> I made a sub-class of the BaseTest say ExtendedTest and here I
overrided
> one of the setup functions and wrote a single test method which will
> assert for exception based on the new setup that was done in the
> ExtendtedTest.
> But when I tried to run the test I found that Junit execute all the
> tests that belonmg to the superClass testCase too and here it uses the
> overrdden setup methods and thus in my case all my super class tests
> fail.
> Is this the expected behavior ? Am I trying the right thing for my
> problem, is there a cleaner way for my kind of a requirement ?
> Please advise,
>  
> Thanks
> Chirag 
>  
>
